shared.model

Class ResourceList

  • java.lang.Object
    • shared.model.ResourceList

  • public class ResourceList
extends java.lang.Object
    A ResourceList where all counts must be non-negative and all mutations are zero-sum between two instances. (i.e. cards should never spontaneously appear or disappear. Rather, they can only be transfered from one ResourceList to another, not created nor destroyed.)
    Author:
    beefster

    • Constructor Detail

      • ResourceList

        public ResourceList()
        Creates an empty ResourceList- e.g. for a player

      • ResourceList

        public ResourceList(int count)
             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a ResourceList with a specific number of each resource- e.g. for the bank at the beginning of a game.
        Parameters:
        count - the amount to have of each resource
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if count is negative.

      • ResourceList

        public ResourceList(java.util.Map<ResourceType,java.lang.Integer> counts)
             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a ResourceList with the given resource amounts. Values will be copied.
        Parameters:
        counts - a map representing the counts for each resource
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the counts are negative.

        Returns:

      • transfer

        public void transfer(ResourceList destination,
            ResourceType type,
            int amount)
              throws InsufficientResourcesException
        Transfers cards from one ResourceList to another
        Parameters:
        destination - the ResourceList to transfer to
        type - the Type of resource to transfer
        amount - the number of cards to transfer
        Throws:
        InsufficientResourcesException - if the precondition is not met.
        Preconditions
        This ResourceList has at least amount cards of the given type in it
        Postconditions
        This list's number of cards will decrease by amount and the destination list will increase by amount

      • transferAtMost

        public void transferAtMost(ResourceList destination,
                  ResourceType type,
                  int amount)
        Transfers cards from one ResourceList to another, but not more than is possible.
        Parameters:
        destination - the ResourceList to transfer to
        type - the Type of resource to transfer
        amount - the maximum number of cards to transfer
        Postconditions
        This list's number of cards will decrease by amount and the destination list will increase by amount
